nodes.text: The E-5 battle droid was a model of battle droid manufactured by Baktoid Combat Automata. Based on the E4 baron droid, it was an interim successor to the B1-Series battle droid and was quickly made obsolete by the B2 super battle droid.

Tall and thin, the E-5 battle droid was based on the design of the E4 baron droid. Featuring armor heavier than that of the B1-Series battle droid, they were equipped with individual intelligence matrices, allowing them to operate independently of a Central Control Computer. However, their lack of intelligence was their greatest weakness, and an E-5's limited verbobrain was said to be as slow as that of any droid tank.

After the Trade Federation's defeat at the Battle of Naboo in the year 32 BBY, the E-5 was secretly designed and manufactured by Baktoid Combat Automata as an interim successor to the B1 battle droid. As a temporary measure, they were produced in small numbers while the Trade Federation developed the B2 super battle droid, quickly rendering the E-5 obsolete.
